supports_foreign_keys.description: Whether tables can have foreign keys

supports_primary_keys.description: Whether tables can have primary keys

supports_schemaless_tables.description: Whether the database supports tables with no defined schema

supports_nested_inserts.description: Whether or not nested inserts to related tables are supported

AtomicitySupportLevel.description:
Describes the level of transactional atomicity the agent supports for mutation operations.
'row': If multiple rows are affected in a single operation but one fails, only the failed row's changes will be reverted
'single_operation': If multiple rows are affected in a single operation but one fails, all affected rows in the operation will be reverted
'homogeneous_operations': If multiple operations of only the same type exist in the one mutation request, a failure in one will result in all changes being reverted
'heterogeneous_operations': If multiple operations of any type exist in the one mutation request, a failure in one will result in all changes being reverted

ComparisonOperators.description:
A map from comparison operator names to their argument types.
Operator and argument type names must be valid GraphQL names.
Argument type names must be defined scalar types declared in ScalarTypesCapabilities.

AggregateFunctions.description:
A map from aggregate function names to their result types.
Function and result type names must be valid GraphQL names.
Result type names must be defined scalar types declared in ScalarTypesCapabilities.

UpdateColumnOperators.description:
A map from update column operator names to their definitions.
Operator names must be valid GraphQL names.

ScalarTypeCapabilities.description:
Capabilities of a scalar type.
comparison_operators: The comparison operators supported by the scalar type.
aggregate_functions: The aggregate functions supported by the scalar type.
update_column_operators: The update column operators supported by the scalar type.
graphql_type: Associates the custom scalar type with one of the built-in GraphQL scalar types.  If a `graphql_type` is specified then HGE will use the parser for that built-in type when parsing values of the custom type. If not given then any JSON value will be accepted.

ScalarTypesCapabilities.description:
A map from scalar type names to their capabilities.
Keys must be valid GraphQL names and must be defined as scalar types in the `graphql_schema`

supports_relations.description: Does the agent support comparisons that involve related tables (ie. joins)?

objectTypes.description: Object type definitions referenced in this schema

TableName.description: The fully qualified name of a table, where the last item in the array is the table name and any earlier items represent the namespacing of the table name

insertable.description: Whether or not the column can be inserted into

updatable.description: Whether or not the column can be updated

column_mapping.description: The columns on which you want want to define the foreign key.

deletable.description: Whether or not existing rows can be deleted in the table

insertable.description: Whether or not new rows can be inserted into the table

primary_key.description: The primary key of the table

updatable.description: Whether or not existing rows can be updated in the table

FunctionName.description: The fully qualified name of a function, where the last item in the array is the function name and any earlier items represent the namespacing of the function name

optional.description: If the argument can be omitted

response_cardinality.description: object response if false, rows if true

only_functions.description: Only get the schemas for these functions

only_tables.description: Only get the schemas for these tables

DetailLevel.description:
How much information to return about the schema. Values:
- 'everything': All information about the schema.
- 'basic_info': For tables, only the table name and table type, for functions, only the function name and function type.

aggregates.description: The results of the aggregates returned by the query

rows.description: The rows returned by the query, corresponding to the query's fields

foreach.description: If present, a list of columns and values for the columns that the query must be repeated for, applying the column values as a filter for each query.

redaction_expressions.description: Expressions that can be referenced by the query to redact fields/columns

relationships.description: The relationships between tables involved in the entire query request

id.description: The id for the query interpolation template

name.description: The name of the named argument

column_mapping.description: A mapping between columns on the source table to columns on the target table

relationships.description: A map of relationships from the interpolated table to targets. The key of the map is the relationship name

source_interpolated_query.description: The source interpolated query involved in the relationship

relationships.description: A map of relationships from the source function to targets. The key of the map is the relationship name
A map of relationships from the source table to targets. The key of the map is the relationship name

interpolated.description: The id of the interpolated query

path.description: The path to the table that contains the specified column. Missing or empty array means the current table. ["$"] means the query table. No other values are supported at this time.

expressions.description: The named redaction expressions associated with the target

id.description: An id associated with the interpolated query - Should be unique across the request

subrelations.description: Further relationships to follow from the relationship's target table. The key of the map is the relationship name.

SingleColumnAggregateFunction.description:
Single column aggregate function name.
A valid GraphQL name

column.description: The column to apply the aggregation function to

target_path.description: The relationship path from the current query table to the table that contains the target to order by. This is always non-empty for aggregate order by targets

elements.description: The elements to order by, in priority order

relations.description: A map of relationships from the current query table to target tables. The key of the map is the relationship name. The relationships are used within the order by elements.

limit.description: Optionally limit the maximum number of returned elements of the array

offset.description: Optionally skip the first n elements of the array

aggregates_limit.description: Optionally limit the maximum number of rows considered while applying aggregations. This limit does not apply to returned rows.

limit.description: Optionally limit the maximum number of returned rows. This limit does not apply to records considered while apply aggregations.

offset.description: Optionally offset from the Nth result. This applies to both row and aggregation results.

relationship.description: The name of the relationship to follow for the subquery

column.description: The column to apply the aggregation function to
The column to apply the count aggregate function to

distinct.description: Whether or not only distinct items should be counted

lines.description: Lines of the formatted explain plan response

query.description: The generated query - i.e. SQL for a relational DB

operation_results.description: The results of each mutation operation, in the same order as they were received

affected_rows.description: The number of rows affected by the mutation operation

returning.description: The rows affected by the mutation operation

insert_schema.description: The schema by which to interpret row data specified in any insert operations in this request

redaction_expressions.description: Expressions that can be referenced by the query to redact fields/columns

relationships.description: The relationships involved in the entire mutation request

relationship.description: The name of the object relationship over which the related row must be inserted
The name of the array relationship over which the related rows must be inserted

column.description: The name of the column that this field should be inserted into

fields.description: The fields that will be found in the insert row data for the table and the schema for each field

primary_key.description: The names of the columns that make up the table's primary key

returning_fields.description: The fields to return for the rows affected by this insert operation

rows.description: The rows to insert into the table

returning_fields.description: The fields to return for the rows affected by this delete operation

column.description: The name of the column in the row

value.description: The value to use with the column operator

column.description: The name of the column in the row

value.description: The value to use with the column operator

returning_fields.description: The fields to return for the rows affected by this update operation

updates.description: The updates to make to the matched rows in the table

rows.description: The rows returned by the raw query.

query.description: A string representing a raw query

exists.description: Message detailing if the dataset exists

message.description: The named dataset to clone from
